title: losing mmr for winning games?

embed.description: Check your Summoner statistics, MMR, realtime spectate and using powerful global LoL Charts!

body:
my last 2 games before the j4 one I've lost mmr for? does it have something to do with me going duo with a lower ranked person?(bronze2)

since those two games & that j4 loss im 70 mmr below what I was originally?

replies.body:
That games MMR not your own. It means that particular game pulled in lower ranked people and so it was expected taht you win it if you MMR exceeds the games MMR.

Also OP.GG is all horse%%%% when it comes to MMR anyway. Its good for tracking stats, but never listen to the MMR calculation crap.
It's not entirely crap, it's just far from being entirely accurate.

> [{quoted}](name=JasonWazza,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=ABRhMlx8,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2015-01-08T07:01:46.674+0000)
>
> It's not entirely crap, it's just far from being entirely accurate.

Okay MR smartypants, what is the correct MMR?

The correct MMR is the one that is on the league servers.

The one OP.GG gives is a rough guess given the fact that there is actual algorithms to match us up against one another.

Unless Duo's are tainting your MMR constantly, your OP.GG MMR would be half decently accurate (doesn't mean that it's useful for anything)

> [{quoted}](name=JasonWazza,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=ABRhMlx8,comment-id=0002000000000000,timestamp=2015-01-08T12:27:08.615+0000)
>
> The correct MMR is the one that is on the league servers.
> 
> The one OP.GG gives is a rough guess given the fact that there is actual algorithms to match us up against one another.
> 

Yeah, this is basically correct - sites like OP.GG try to estimate what your true MMR is, which isn't shown anywhere in the client, but is used for the matchmaking algorithm.

Just to answer OP's question - you will never lose MMR for winning a game. It might be variable how much it goes up on based on the game, but it'll never actually decrease after a win.

MMR hasn't shown since Season 2.. lmfao.
No %%%% sherlock, that doesn't mean it doesn't exist.
how do you know you've lost mmr. op.gg bases mmr off of your opponents, it's not accurate.

Fact: Duoing is no longer able to be tracked by OP.GG and if you read, they flat out tell you that duoing will change your MMR artifically and that is why they normally wouldn't count it.

Fact is if you duo, your MMR for OP.GG will be even more inaccurate, and not only that it's already obvious from your Game MMR's (they go from 1100 to just below 1300) that you have been duoing.

If you are duoing in the last 4-5 games OP.GG MMR calculations will be off.
